1.text: “Yes, at this my heart trembles, and is moved out of its place.

2.text: Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice, the sound that goes out of his mouth.

3.text: He sends it forth under the whole sky, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a voice roars. He thunders with the voice of his majesty. He doesn’t hold back anything when his voice is heard.

5.text: God thunders marvelously with his voice. He does great things, which we can’t comprehend.

6.text: For he says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth;’ likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of his mighty rain.

7.text: He seals up the hand of every man, that all men whom he has made may know it.

8.text: Then the animals take cover, and remain in their dens.

9.text: Out of its room comes the storm, and cold out of the north.

10.text: By the breath of God, ice is given, and the breadth of the waters is frozen.

11.text: Yes, he loads the thick cloud with moisture. He spreads abroad the cloud of his lightning.

12.text: It is turned around by his guidance, that they may do whatever he commands them on the surface of the habitable world,

13.text: Whether it is for correction, or for his land, or for loving kindness, that he causes it to come.

14.text: “Listen to this, Job. Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Do you know how God controls them, and causes the lightning of his cloud to shine?

16.text: Do you know the workings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: You whose clothing is warm, when the earth is still by reason of the south wind?

18.text: Can you, with him, spread out the sky, which is strong as a cast metal mirror?

19.text: Teach us what we shall tell him, for we can’t make our case by reason of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be told him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?

21.text: Now men don’t see the light which is bright in the skies, but the wind passes, and clears them.

22.text: Out of the north comes golden splendor. With God is awesome majesty.

23.text: We can’t reach the Almighty. He is exalted in power. In justice and great righteousness, he will not oppress.

24.text: Therefore men revere him. He doesn’t regard any who are wise of heart.”
